abstract.value: Chalmers K. Stewart was an active member of the Workers Party and Independent Socialist Leauge in the 1940s and 1950s.  This collection contains an autobiographical typescript, internal documents of the Workers Party and Independent Socialist League, correspondence, writings, research notes, and photographs.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Chalmers K. Stewart Papers; TAM 177; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Gift of Betty Elkin Stewart in 1995; additional materials were donated in 2001. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 1995.031, 1995.032, and NPA.2002.021.

From 1950 to 1958, he was employed as a draftsman-checker-designer by various New Jersey engineering firms. In 1959, he returned to teaching, spending four years teaching at high schools in New Jersey. In 1963, he moved to Oyster Bay, New York, and taught English at Huntington High School, Huntington, New York, until he retired in 1973. In 1979 he began dividing his time between Oyster Bay and Akron, finally making Akron his only home in 1989. On November 13, 1990, he married Betty Lee Elkin of Tucson, Arizona, a former National Secretary of the Socialist Party. Stewart contributed to a number of socialist journals under the names James Fenwick, Blake Lear and Donald A. Hill. He died of complications following a stroke on February 26, 1995.

The Chalmers K. Stewart Papers contains an autobiographical typescript, internal documents of the Workers Party and Independent Socialist League, correspondence, writings, research notes, and photographs.

dsc.value:
Series I: Autobiographical Typescript and Biographical Materialscirca 1985-19954Scope and Content Note

Series I includes an autobiographical typescript written during the late 1980s or early 1990s. It is in the format of a personal journal and describes Stewart's early years, his political activities, and extensive reflections on current affairs. This series also contains correspondence between Stewart and several friends and political associates, as well as memorabilia.

Series II: Workers Party and Independent Socialist League Activities1942-19581234Scope and Content Note

Series II contains internal documents of the Workers Party and Independent Socialist League, as well as some correspondence. These internal bulletins, minutes, reports, memos, position papers, directives, and proceedings provide good documentation of the activities, internal dynamics, and evolution of the political views of these organizations. This series also contains correspondence to and from foreign comrades which Stewart handled at the request of the national office.

Series III: Graduate Education and Later Writings and Activitiescirca 1959-19958Scope and Content Note

Series III contains notes and correspondence pertaining to a proposed dissertation on the sociology of the Workers Party and Independent Socialist League and other writing and correspondence.

Series IV: Addendumcirca 1928-19955679Scope and Content Note

Series IV contains Stewart's diaries from the 1930s through the 1980s, correspondence to his mother and sister, friends' non-fiction writings and plays, poetry, and fiction and non-fiction writings. This series also includes photographs of Stewart's funeral, as well as a photograph album containing 67 black and white photographs with substantive captions depicting town life in North-Central West Virginia in 1947. Also included in this series are materials related to Stewart's memorial service and letters of condolence sent to Betty Elkin Stewart.
